metadata.synopsis: After the destruction of the brain, the survivors swim to shore (END_BrainBattle_DestructionOfBrain). Now, they take stock of their victory, and the burning city. While conversing, the githyanki depart on their red dragons. Lae’zel can join them or not if she’s present.Karlach leaves to die (in END_GameFinale_DeathOfKarlach). Towards the end of the dialogue, the party members wonder what to do next.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Dear cinematics team - we are really sorry for all the hardship we caused you but we wanted you to know we love you dearly and appreciate tremendously the way you bring our words to life. With love,The writing team

585.speaker: Lae'zel
585.text: You - Orpheus. Abomination. You have served your purpose, now - you will die.

474.speaker: Orpheus
474.text: Do what you must. I cannot live in this skin any longer.
474.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus kneels nobly, offering himself for death.

569.speaker: Shadowheart
569.text: He sacrificed everything in order to save our lives, Lae'zel. That ought to count for something to you.

502.speaker: Wyll
502.text: The Prince of the Comet has fallen. He sacrificed everything to stop the Grand Design. Does that mean nothing to you, Lae'zel?

241.speaker: Gale
241.text: He sacrificed his soul to save your people, Lae'zel. Surrendered his very being to prevent the Grand Design. I'd say it's a tad ungrateful to murder him for it.

407.speaker: Halsin
407.text: He paid the ultimate price, to save our lives. That should count for something, Lae'zel.

243.speaker: Jaheira
243.text: He gave his life for ours, Lae'zel. You might give him the death he seeks without claiming it as some victory.

566.speaker: Minsc
566.text: He asks for death, Lae'zel. I think he has earned a noble and a quiet one, yes?

653.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
653.text: Do what you must, Lae'zel. But make it quick - we would have perished long ago without his protection.

387.speaker: Astarion
387.text: Yes, put the poor beast out of its misery.

639.speaker: Astarion
639.text: He gave up everything to save us, Lae'zel. Is this really the best you can offer him?

88.speaker: Player
88.text: He made the ultimate sacrifice to save our lives. Are you sure this is what you want, Lae'zel?

261.speaker: Lae'zel
261.text: Save your sympathy. He is hshar'lak. Traitor, and ghaik.

181.speaker: Lae'zel
181.text: You made a promise to me when we freed him, and I intend to hold you to it, as I hold myself bound to my Queen.

665.speaker: Lae'zel
665.text: Though I may call you ally, I do not need your blessing to fulfil my duty.

563.speaker: Lae'zel
563.text: It was my Queen's decree that he should die, and I intend to honour it.

674.speaker: Player
674.text: Orpheus, will you not fight back?

370.speaker: Orpheus
370.text: Lae'zel is right. I am an abomination, I feel it even now.

455.speaker: Lae'zel
455.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel raises her sword/dagger to strike at Orpheus.

578.speaker: Player
578.text: Utter a blessing to Prince Orpheus, under your breath.

722.speaker: Player
722.text: Watch as Lae'zel fulfils her destiny.

85.speaker: Lae'zel
85.text: It is done. A fitting death for a traitor.

624.speaker: Lae'zel
624.text: To slay a ghaik was my sworn duty. To kill Orpheus was my privilege.

128.speaker: Lae'zel
128.text: My people are leaving, and I must leave with them. I must call out to Tu'narath - my ascension's at hand.

776.speaker: Player
776.text: Stab her before her weapon strikes.

476.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stabs Lae'zel in the back (not shown). Player drops to the ground (leaving sword on the ground.)

638.speaker: Orpheus
638.text: You killed your ally to save a mind flayer? A poignant act, but a wasteful one.
638.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands over Laezel's body.

177.speaker: Orpheus
177.text: She was blinded by her faith, but true in her devotion.
177.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands over Laezel's body.

333.speaker: Orpheus
333.text: I remain an abomination. I cannot live like this.
333.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands over Laezel's body.

40.speaker: Orpheus
40.text: Even when my time in the Prism stretched out like eternity - when escape seemed impossible - I never lost hope.

439.speaker: Orpheus
439.text: I knew that my destiny was to liberate my people. To return to them triumphant.

524.speaker: Orpheus
524.text: It seems I can only fulfil one part of my destiny - my people will be liberated, but I cannot return to them. Not like this.

545.speaker: Orpheus
545.text: You helped me destroy that abomination. Now help me destroy myself. You must kill me.
545.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus gets down on one knee and holds out his sword. The player takes it.

597.speaker: Orpheus
597.text: But first, Lae'zel, I need your promise.

198.speaker: Orpheus
198.text: Carry my hope, carry my burden.  Call my dragons, Quulos and Quuthos, and ride to the Astral Sea. Destroy Vlaakith, release our people. Be our future and our legacy.

661.speaker: Player
661.text: I will slay Vlaakith and free our people. You have my promise, Orpheus.

607.speaker: Orpheus
607.text: You honour me. And now, you must give me the greatest honour - freedom from this form.

356.speaker: Player
356.text: It was on Faerûn that I learned how to be free. This will be my home.

438.speaker: Player
438.text: I won't. There's someone I care about. I will stay here, find my own way forward.

523.speaker: Orpheus
523.text: But first, Lae'zel, I need your promise.

499.speaker: Orpheus
499.text: Carry my hope, carry my burden.  Call my dragons, Quulos and Quuthos, and ride to the Astral Sea. Destroy Vlaakith, release our people. Be our future and our legacy.

530.speaker: Player
530.text: Call the dragons, Lae'zel. I will join you, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Call the dragons, Lae'zel. I will join you, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

767.speaker: Lae'zel
767.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. How I long to say yes.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: But you have chosen a path for yourself, and it does not lead to the Astral Plane.

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. You honour me.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Vlaakith will fall, and we will plant a seed. From that seed, githyanki freedom will blossom.

694.speaker: Player
694.text: Call the dragons, Lae'zel. I will join you, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

320.speaker: Player
320.text: Call the dragons, Lae'zel. I will join you, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

551.speaker: Lae'zel
551.text: You understand, then. We will never be free while our people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: Vlaakith will fall, and we will plant a seed. From that seed, githyanki freedom will blossom.

309.speaker: Orpheus
309.text: La'ch cras'ht h'mak vlek! So be it. Now - give me my freedom from this form.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: You should do this, Lae'zel. Your people need you.

105.speaker: Lae'zel
105.text: Duty... All my life, I've travelled in its slipstream, not once questioning its path. In its service, I came here. And now, in its service, I leave.

690.speaker: Lae'zel
690.text: I will carry your hope, Prince Orpheus, and I will carry your burden. But to that burden I must add my own - the loss of those I leave behind.

549.speaker: Lae'zel
549.text: It will be done. I will never be free while my people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

754.speaker: Orpheus
754.text: Enough talk - give me my freedom, freedom from this form.

487.speaker: Player
487.text: You have found new purpose here, with me. Stay here, and we'll find our own way.

369.speaker: Player
369.text: You sure you want to go straight into another war? Why not rest here in Faerûn for a while.

470.speaker: Player
470.text: You sure you want to go straight into another war? Why not rest here in Faerûn for a while.

114.speaker: Lae'zel
114.text: Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here that I learned what it meant to be adored, to be free.

571.speaker: Orpheus
571.text: Then my destiny is undone. Until someone can take up my cause, the githyanki will remain chained.

784.speaker: Orpheus
784.text: I found freedom, and then lost myself to this horror for nothing. All that remains is to die.

481.speaker: Player
481.text: You have found new purpose here, Lae'zel. Stay in Faerûn, craft a new fate.

286.speaker: Lae'zel
286.text: Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here, with you, that I learned what it meant to be free.

565.speaker: Lae'zel
565.text: Yes - I will stay. My destiny is for neither Vlaakith nor Orpheus to decree. It is mine.

335.speaker: Lae'zel
335.text: I have already chosen a way - the way of Orpheus. Vlaakith will fall, and I will plant a seed. From that seed, githyanki freedom will blossom.

659.speaker: Lae'zel
659.text: Your will is strong, ra'stil. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

483.speaker: Player
483.text: You sure you want to go straight into another war? Why not rest here in Faerûn for a while.

706.speaker: Player
706.text: This is your choice to make, Lae'zel, not mine. I entrust it to you.

766.speaker: Lae'zel
766.text: Then you will come with me, and we will destroy the lich queen together.

338.speaker: Lae'zel
338.text: Duty... All my life, I've travelled in its slipstream, not once questioning its path. In its service, I came here. And now, in its service, I leave.

156.speaker: Orpheus
156.text: Do it quickly. I cannot live in this skin a moment longer.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus kneels before the player as a mind flayer.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *You promised your Queen you would do this.*

687.speaker: Narrator
687.text: *To slay a ghaik was your sworn duty, to execute Orpheus will be an honour indeed. You will surely ascend, and ascend in glory.*

337.speaker: Narrator
337.text: *But the rebel prince is the only reason you are still alive. It was his power that protected you from the Netherbrain. Does he deserve to die?*

789.speaker: Player
789.text: Get up, Orpheus. For what you've done, you deserve to live.

621.speaker: Orpheus
621.text: I will not be ghaik! I did what I did to save my people.

695.speaker: Orpheus
695.text: The revolution against Vlaakith will come. Perhaps some day you might see truth, Lae'zel, and join it.

358.speaker: Orpheus
358.text: I trust that our people will have their freedom, but now I must have mine. Release my soul to the Astral Seas, while I still have one to call my own.

555.speaker: Player
555.text: Give Orpheus the honourable death he craves.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Say what you will - I have no intention of killing you.

443.speaker: Orpheus
443.text: Then I will do once more what must be done.

357.speaker: Orpheus
357.text: It was an honour to fight beside you to end the Grand Design.

151.speaker: Orpheus
151.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus kills himself plunging his sword into his stomach, and speaks his last words from a kneeling position before collapsing

726.speaker: Narrator
726.text: *Prince Orpheus is gone. But the githyanki's future has not died with him.*
726.context: InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel avatar agreed to fight for Orpehus, not illithid

763.speaker: Narrator
763.text: *Your heart flutters with excitement as you call out for the dragons. The Astral Plane awaits, and a rebellion takes shape. Your rebellion.*
763.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Dragon flies in and Lae'zel mounts it.|

567.speaker: Shadowheart
567.text: Farewell, Lae'zel. May the dark lady guide your blade.

204.speaker: Shadowheart
204.text: Farewell, Lae'zel. I'm a better person for having met you.

362.speaker: Astarion
362.text: Lae'zel, darling - there never was one so delicious as you. Until we meet again.

291.speaker: Wyll
291.text: Good-bye Lae'zel, fiercest of warriors. My heart remains yours, always.

541.speaker: Gale
541.text: Go forth, Lae'zel, to distant realms. I will miss you dearly.

257.speaker: Karlach
257.text: Goodbye, Lae'zel. You've been absolutely unforgettable.

170.speaker: Halsin
170.text: Fly on, Lae'zel. May the Oak Father preserve you and guide you true.

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *The future of the Githyanki Empire rests in your hands. And you know just how to mould it...*
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel flies off on the dragon.|InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel avatar flies off. Cue epilogue without her.

352.speaker: Lae'zel
352.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Dragons fly in and player and Lae'zel mount them.|InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel companion, player agreed to join her in Orpheus fight

743.speaker: Narrator
743.text: *Your heart flutters with excitement, aspiration, and even - hope. The Astral Plane awaits, a rebellion takes shape.*

397.speaker: Narrator
397.text: *The future of the Githyanki Empire rests on your shoulders. Battle awaits - and you mean to rise victorious.*
397.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player and Lae'zel fly off together.|InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel and player fly off on their dragons. Cue epilogue without them.

716.speaker: Lae'zel
716.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Dragon flie in and Lae'zel mounts it.|InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel companion

422.speaker: Lae'zel
422.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. Without you, I wouldn't have known warmth - only ice and fire.

202.speaker: Lae'zel
202.text: I can never forget you. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

164.speaker: Lae'zel
164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off on a dragon.

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: A fitting death for a traitor.

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *Prince Orpheus is dead. With his death, Queen Vlaakith's glory is secured, and so is your own.*

453.speaker: Shadowheart
453.text: He was as noble in spirit as he was in bloodline. We're in his debt.

540.speaker: Astarion
540.text: Well, that was a kindness. Can you imagine living like that? Urgh.

144.speaker: Astarion
144.text: He really did give everything for his people - and for us. I hope he finally knows peace.

760.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up to transition to GithAreLeaving

664.speaker: Wyll
664.text: A brave and noble prince. May the stories of his sacrifice travel far and wide.

345.speaker: Gale
345.text: A kinder fate than to live as one's sworn enemy, though no less a pity for it. At least in legend, the Prince of the Comet will live forever.

450.speaker: Halsin
450.text: He did not hesitate. A true sacrifice, and a noble spirit. May his spirit find its way home.

255.speaker: Jaheira
255.text: Imprisoned most of his life, and he freely gave what little remained to save his people. Rare, that a hero actually lives up to their prophecy.

248.speaker: Minsc
248.text: The princeling deserved a better end than this. We shall remember him, Boo.

392.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
392.text: We would not have survived any of this without him. May he find peace.

702.speaker: Lae'zel
702.text: As noble in death as he was in life. His sacrifice will not be forgotten.

606.speaker: Orpheus
606.text: The rest is up to them. Someone else must rise within the ranks to lead the revolution against Vlaakith.

725.speaker: Orpheus
725.text: Give me my freedom from this form, release my soul to the Astral Seas while I still have one to call my own.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: Give Orpheus the honourable death he craves.

698.speaker: Orpheus
698.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Player kills Orpheus. He thanks them with his dying breath, and slips into a peaceful death.|

104.speaker: Player
104.text: You may not be able to return to your people, Orpheus. But you deserve to live to see their future.

208.speaker: Orpheus
208.text: Perhaps you are right. I may not be the one to lead my people, but I can still bear witness to their glory.

285.speaker: Orpheus
285.text: I shall find a place for myself in a corner of these realms, for even in darkness, the stars of Tu'narath will shine upon me.

201.speaker: Shadowheart
201.text: His people are lucky to have such a noble prince. I hope manages to adjust to his new way of life.

234.speaker: Astarion
234.text: I'm glad the gith prince is taking his fate so well. I'd be devastated if I was that ugly.

685.speaker: Astarion
685.text: He seems to be taking his new, monstrous form pretty well. Maybe he is worthy to be the gith's prince.

490.speaker: Wyll
490.text: Never have I known a prince more noble. I hope he can find peace.

194.speaker: Gale
194.text: Freedom is freedom, no matter the form. I hope he finds peace with his newfound nature - it's the least he deserves.

677.speaker: Halsin
677.text: His people are blessed to have him as their prince. I just hope he finds peace in his new form.

473.speaker: Jaheira
473.text: Homecomings are never easy. I fear Orpheus will find the githyanki much changed - and they him.

622.speaker: Minsc
622.text: The githyanki will find they have a noble prince in Orpheus. If they do not slaughter him on sight, at least.

327.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
327.text: He does not deserve to be an outcast. I hope he finds peace, wherever he makes his home.

532.speaker: Orpheus
532.text: You mean well, but you do not understand.

432.speaker: Player
432.text: You're a mind flayer, but you're still you, aren't you?

696.speaker: Orpheus
696.text: My mind screams. It will never stop until it has slipped away from me entirely.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Kill him. Give him the honourable death he craves.

411.speaker: Karlach
411.text: It's all right. I knew what I was doing.

663.speaker: Orpheus
663.text: I will ensure that all githyanki know your name - and your sacrifice. What you have done today will start a fire that rages across the Astral Plane.

449.speaker: Orpheus
449.text: With their lost prince returned, my people will burn away Vlaakith's corruption. And it is all thanks to you - the illithid who defied a Netherbrain.

433.speaker: Player
433.text: I still think we should have made Orpheus become a mind flayer instead of you, Karlach.

246.speaker: Karlach
246.text: Don't worry about me. I'm... happy.

372.speaker: Karlach
372.text: I saved the fucking world. And I think I might live long enough to tell the tale, too.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Good luck to you, Prince Orpheus.

494.speaker: Orpheus
494.text: I thank you, my liberator, my saviour.

538.speaker: Narrator
538.text: *He may have no reason to thank you, yet. You promised your Queen that you would end him. Now that the Netherbrain is defeated, the moment is yours.*

456.speaker: Narrator
456.text: *He may have no reason to thank you, yet. Now that the Netherbrain is defeated, the moment is yours.*

615.speaker: Narrator
615.text: *Kill Orpheus, and you will ascend. Let him live, and you will never know Vlaakith's honour. You will be hshar'lak - traitor to your people, traitor to your Queen.*

463.speaker: Player
463.text: Kill Orpheus. Fulfil your duty to Vlaakith.

368.speaker: Shadowheart
368.text: And there I was, thinking the killing was over.

237.speaker: Wyll
237.text: The last death of the day, I hope. Your duty is fulfilled.

707.speaker: Gale
707.text: The depth of your commitment to your cause truly knows no bounds. For him to have survived a Netherbrain only to be ended by your hand... well, it is an end, I suppose.

739.speaker: Halsin
739.text: I cannot say I understand the reason for his death, but nature will reclaim him all the same.

101.speaker: Jaheira
101.text: A decisive end to the one whose powers protected you. I hope whatever you gain from his sacrifice is worth it.

84.speaker: Minsc
84.text: Boo is conflicted. He liked Orpheus, but he likes you more, and killing him seems to have made you happy.

272.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
272.text: He served his purpose. And you have served yours.

215.speaker: Astarion
215.text: He helped to kill a Netherbrain, only to be slain by one of his own... extraordinary.

263.speaker: Astarion
263.text: He helped to kill a Netherbrain only to be slain by one of his own - a little unnecessary, don't you think?

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Orpheus is the only reason you are alive. He will not die by your hand.

504.speaker: Lae'zel
504.text: Save your thanks, traitor. They are hardly worth the breath you waste to speak them.

630.speaker: Orpheus
630.text: You are blinded by your loyalty, child. Still, I cannot blame you. A false queen's lies may yet ring true to honourable ears.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Don't worry about me. I feel more powerful than ever.

220.speaker: Player
220.text: It's all right. I like what I've become.

593.speaker: Player
593.text: That was very insensitive of you.

623.speaker: Orpheus
623.text: I will ensure that all githyanki know your name - and your sacrifice. What you have done today will start a fire that rages across the Astral Plane.

603.speaker: Narrator
603.text: *Can your people really celebrate you in such a form as this? Your sworn duty was to slay a ghaik, not become one.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *And you promised your Queen that you would slay Orpheus, not return him.*

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *If you slay him now, would it be enough to convince Queen Vlaakith to ascend you, even as an illithid?*

292.speaker: Player
292.text: Your fate matters not. Kill Orpheus. Fulfil your duty to your people and your Queen.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Let Orpheus live. You are already damned.

253.speaker: Narrator
253.text: *Orpheus was supposed to die by your hand.*

748.speaker: Lae'zel
748.text: The fire will rage, but you will not be there to see it. The Astral Seas have no place for you, hshar'lak.

705.speaker: Orpheus
705.text: I sense the fire rages fiercest in you, Lae'zel. I cannot blame you. Our queen has blinded you for too long.

330.speaker: Lae'zel
330.text: You dare speak ill of my Queen? I will end you, Orpheus.

79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel raises her sword/dagger to strike at Orpheus.

512.speaker: Player
512.text: Watch as Lae'zel fulfils her destiny.

755.speaker: Player
755.text: Stab her before her weapon strikes.

373.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player plunges their own dagger into Lae'zel. She drops her weapon in surprise, and falls to her knees.

134.speaker: Orpheus
134.text: Even as she would have struck me down, I cannot celebrate this child's death. Her devotion to her queen was without fault. It was Vlaakith who failed her.

31.speaker: Orpheus
31.text: With their lost prince returned, my people will burn away Vlaakith's corruption. And it is all thanks to you - the illithid who defied a Netherbrain.

732.speaker: Player
732.text: My work here is not done yet. I have greater ambitions I have yet to achieve.

631.speaker: Orpheus
631.text: You have aided me in achieving my ambitions, I wish you well in yours.

730.speaker: Player
730.text: The best illithid in all the land. Make sure your people know that.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: I'd rather be remembered for who I was before.

399.speaker: Orpheus
399.text: And I must leave with them.

359.speaker: Orpheus
359.text: I shall not speak of Lae'zel's final act. Her story will be written as it was before - a warrior, who ended the Grand Design.

688.speaker: Orpheus
688.text: Lae'zel. Some will look at you and see an abomination. But I see something else. A revolutionary.

544.speaker: Orpheus
544.text: Come. We will free the githyanki and dismantle the empire. Let them be imprisoned no longer!

646.speaker: Narrator
646.text: *The hope in his voice is sincere, fervent even. But in spite of your desire to believe him, you know the truth. You are ghaik. You will not be welcome in the Astral Sea, and nor will he.*

193.speaker: Player
193.text: I will take up your cause. Together, we will vanquish Vlaakith for good.

416.speaker: Shadowheart
416.text: Farewell, Lae'zel. May the dark lady guide your blade.

644.speaker: Shadowheart
644.text: Farewell, Lae'zel. I'm a better person for having met you.

629.speaker: Astarion
629.text: Lae'zel, darling - there never was one so delicious as you. Until we meet again.

385.speaker: Wyll
385.text: Good-bye Lae'zel, fiercest of warriors. My heart remains yours, always.

618.speaker: Gale
618.text: Go forth, Lae'zel, to distant realms. I will miss you dearly.

277.speaker: Karlach
277.text: Goodbye, Lae'zel. You've been absolutely unforgettable.

518.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel and Orpheus fly off on their dragons. Same animation as N285 but without the spoken line.|

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *The future of the githyanki rests in your hands. And you know just how to mould it.*

704.speaker: Halsin
704.text: Fly on, Lae'zel. May the Oak Father preserve you and guide you true.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: It was on Faerûn that I learned how to be free. Go on without me - this will be my home.

322.speaker: Orpheus
322.text: I will not say I'm pleased with your choice - but I will wish you many fortunes. Whatever may come, you are still T'lak'ma Ghir - Sister in Freedom.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.

689.speaker: Narrator
689.text: *The world is yours for the taking. A world you have made your own.*

554.speaker: Player
554.text: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?

312.speaker: Player
312.text: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*

497.speaker: Narrator
497.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

29.speaker: Player
29.text: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.

613.speaker: Player
613.text: There's someone I care about. I will stay here, find my own way forward.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I cannot return to our people. Not like this...

6.speaker: Orpheus
6.text: Come, Lae'zel. We will free the githyanki and dismantle the empire. Let them be imprisoned no longer!

68.speaker: Orpheus
68.text: Come, Lae'zel. We will free the githyanki and dismantle the empire. Let them be imprisoned no longer!

520.speaker: Player
520.text: I will join you both, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I will join you both, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: I will join you both, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

751.speaker: Lae'zel
751.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. How I long to say yes.

750.speaker: Lae'zel
750.text: But you have chosen a path for yourself, and it does not lead to the Astral Plane.

305.speaker: Lae'zel
305.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. You honour me.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I will join you both, and we will slay the traitorous lich queen.

427.speaker: Orpheus
427.text: An illithid ally... it would be most unorthodox... but advantageous...

179.speaker: Orpheus
179.text: T'lak'ma Stil - Friend in Freedom. I welcome you to the fight.

360.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel pulls the player up onto the dragon

498.speaker: Orpheus
498.text: Come, both of you. The future begins.
498.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The player, Orpheus, and Lae'zel fly off on the two dragons.|

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Your duty is to your people, Lae'zel. Go with Orpheus, and lead them to freedom.

542.speaker: Lae'zel
542.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy. Without you, I wouldn't know warmth - only ice and fire.

213.speaker: Lae'zel
213.text: I can never forget you. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

744.speaker: Lae'zel
744.text: Until recently, I'd never felt the regret of an unwanted farewell. And now, I feel it double.

581.speaker: Lae'zel
581.text: I say farewell to a lover. And I say farewell to you, a staunch ally and... friend.

668.speaker: Lae'zel
668.text: Chk - then stay, turn your back on your people. But you will never truly be free while our people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

123.speaker: Orpheus
123.text: Be gentle, Lae'zel. Who are we to offer freedom's fruits, only to refuse our own kin a taste?

684.speaker: Lae'zel
684.text: It will be done. I will never be free while my people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

343.speaker: Lae'zel
343.text: Your will is strong, ra'stil. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: You have found new purpose here, Lae'zel. Stay in Faerûn, craft a new fate.

586.speaker: Lae'zel
586.text: Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here, with you, that I learned what it meant to be free.

626.speaker: Lae'zel
626.text: Orpheus - I'll remain here. My destiny is for neither you nor Vlaakith to set. It is mine alone.

509.speaker: Orpheus
509.text: I will not say I'm pleased with your choice - but I will wish you good fortunes. Whatever may come, you are still T'lak'ma Ghir - Sister in Freedom.

51.speaker: Orpheus
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragon lands. Orpheus mounts it.|

210.speaker: Narrator
210.text: *Easy indeed, for some to leave. But others - you - have one more threshold to cross.*

491.speaker: Lae'zel
491.text: I have already chosen a way - the way of Orpheus. Vlaakith will fall, and we will plant a seed. From that seed, githyanki freedom will blossom.

539.speaker: Lae'zel
539.text: Your will is strong, ra'stil. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

61.speaker: Orpheus
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Two dragons land. Lae'zel mounts one, and Orpheus mounts the other.|

612.speaker: Orpheus
612.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel and Orpheus fly off on their dragons.|

471.speaker: Player
471.text: You have found new purpose here, Lae'zel. Stay with me, let us craft a new fate.

627.speaker: Lae'zel
627.text: It... it's not meant to be. You are ghaik. As noble as you are, this is a threshold I cannot cross.

728.speaker: Player
728.text: You have found new purpose here, Lae'zel. Stay with me, let us craft a new fate.

482.speaker: Player
482.text: No. You have found new purpose, Lae'zel. You can craft a new fate here, with your partner.

218.speaker: Lae'zel
218.text: Yes. Yes. Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here that I learned what it meant to be free.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: This is your choice to make, Lae'zel, not mine. I entrust it to you.

329.speaker: Lae'zel
329.text: Then you will come with me, and we will destroy the lich queen together.

63.speaker: Lae'zel
63.text: You are right. My choice, my life. I will know true liberation.

245.speaker: Lae'zel
245.text: Mother Gith battled for liberty - but it was only here that I learned what it meant to be free.

756.speaker: Lae'zel
756.text: Then I must go with the Prince. I will never be free while my people are still bound by Vlaakith's chains.

435.speaker: Lae'zel
435.text: Your will is strong, ra'stil. Your name will be etched in our slates. You will be called Mla'ghir - liberator.

692.speaker: Player
692.text: I couldn't have done it alone - remember my friends, when you remember me.

714.speaker: Player
714.text: Let it be known to all your people - not all mind flayers are alike.

143.speaker: Orpheus
143.text: They have endured an age of darkness and tyranny, though most did not know it. When my war against Vlaakith is done, everything will change.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: To be honest, I wish I'd made you do it.

406.speaker: Orpheus
406.text: It is understandable that you regret this... horror you have endured. But you made the right choice - my people need their prince.

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *She may have succeeded, but you... Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have been abandoned by your queen.*

723.speaker: Narrator
723.text: *The threat of the Grand Design is over, but your people will never accept you back into their embrace.*

252.speaker: Narrator
252.text: *You are a mind flayer, the very thing you sought to eradicate. Whatever self you still possess is quickly ebbing away.*

553.speaker: Narrator
553.text: *Your friends and enemies alike are ripe for manipulation, and if not manipulation, then consumption.*

628.speaker: Narrator
628.text: *Soon you will not be able to trust yourself at all. You will be a monstrosity beyond redemption.*

590.speaker: Narrator
590.text: *Or not. Perhaps you are unique among illithid-kind. Perhaps you will retain enough of who you are to resist your nature.*

367.speaker: Narrator
367.text: *A rogue mind flayer. Like the Emperor.*

426.speaker: Narrator
426.text: *The risk is certainly yours to take - will you?*

531.speaker: Player
531.text: You are a mind flayer now. You have never been so wise, nor strong, nor cool. Embrace it.

511.speaker: Player
511.text: Trust that everything will be fine. How could it not be?

281.speaker: Player
281.text: You will survive, but you will be ready to take your life if you feel the slightest loss of control.

274.speaker: Player
274.text: The risk to others is too great. Take your own life.

475.speaker: Narrator
475.text: *What happens next will be by your design, and yours alone.*

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *They may have succeeded, but you... Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have been abandoned by your queen.*

737.speaker: Lae'zel
737.text: Tsk'va - you may have succeeded, but I have failed. Gith's son is dead, and Vlaakith has abandoned me.

382.speaker: Lae'zel
382.text: I will be hunted by her Inquisition to the ends of the world.

224.speaker: Lae'zel
224.text: I must leave. I have nothing more to gain by being here.

389.speaker: Player
389.text: You have me. Stay for me.

142.speaker: Lae'zel
142.text: Zhak vo'n'fynh duj - source of my joy, I wish...

122.speaker: Lae'zel
122.text: No, I will not hesitate - this is my home. My destiny is for neither Vlaakith nor Orpheus to decree. It is mine.

525.speaker: Lae'zel
525.text: We've shared so much together. I wish...

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: But you are ghaik. As noble as you are, this is a threshold I cannot cross. This is where our fates diverge.

386.speaker: Player
386.text: You have found someone important here. Stay for them.

127.speaker: Lae'zel
127.text: Perhaps - perhaps yes. Without them, I wouldn't have known warmth, only ice and fire.

745.speaker: Lae'zel
745.text: Perhaps there is a future here...

429.speaker: Lae'zel
429.text: Yes - I will stay. My destiny is for neither Vlaakith nor Orpheus to decree. It is mine.

680.speaker: Player
680.text: We faced a Netherbrain together and won. Doesn't that mean anything to you?

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: You helped my people end the Grand Design - for this, I will remember you. But I will not forget what you have cost us.

73.speaker: Lae'zel
73.text: I will remember the fights we fought together, but my next fights will be without you.

401.speaker: Player
401.text: Good luck, Lae'zel. I hope you find what you're looking for.

719.speaker: Lae'zel
719.text: The world looms before me - never has it felt so vast, and so empty. But at least it will be a world in which there is no Grand Design.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: You have me. Please stay. For me.

117.speaker: Lae'zel
117.text: It will be a restless life, while the false queen reigns over my people. But a life, nonetheless - and a free one.

299.speaker: Lae'zel
299.text: We fought well together. I will gladly fight with you again. If not the Astral Seas, then here, and wherever else we go.

543.speaker: Lae'zel
543.text: It was under your watch that my Prince was slaughtered.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: You had the means to free Orpheus, but you chose not to.

506.speaker: Lae'zel
506.text: I watched you consume his mind.

228.speaker: Lae'zel
228.text: It is true you helped me end the Grand Design. But the path you chose has cost my people greatly. I will thank you, but I will not stay for you.

604.speaker: Player
604.text: You have me. Please stay. For me.

317.speaker: Player
317.text: I wish I'd done it instead of you.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Don't worry about me. I feel more powerful than ever.

412.speaker: Lae'zel
412.text: I have crossed blades with countless warriors among the Tears of Selûne. But none so resilient as you.

729.speaker: Shadowheart
729.text: This wouldn't have been possible without you. We'd all be the thralls of that thing, or worse. Instead, we're free.

161.speaker: Wyll
161.text: Before we met, some hailed me as a saviour, some as a legend. But now, I've seen the face of true heroism: yours.

364.speaker: Gale
364.text: If it wasn't for you, we'd be thralls, dead, or who knows. This is your victory.

124.speaker: Halsin
124.text: This victory would not have been possible without you. I will never forget that.

301.speaker: Jaheira
301.text: They'll write stories of this, of course - each fable sprouting more falsehoods than the last. But for that one seed of truth: you. You did this.

24.speaker: Minsc
24.text: I will be serious for a moment. Often Minsc speaks for his hamster, but now he speaks from his own heart, too - thank you. You saved us.

121.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
121.text: Without you, the brain would have enthralled me again. I would rather die... I owe you everything.

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: Although credit where it's due - you were a worthy ally up there. If not for you, that brain may have bested us.

686.speaker: Astarion
686.text: And credit where credit's due - you saved us. You saved this whole city.

425.speaker: Player
425.text: It's all right. I like what I've become.

605.speaker: The Emperor
605.text: And rightly so. You are better now than you've ever been.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: That was very insensitive of you.

703.speaker: The Emperor
703.text: Ignore them. You are better now than you've ever been.

379.speaker: Lae'zel
379.text: Only mild offence intended. You did us a great service - and I'm grateful for it.

505.speaker: The Emperor
505.text: It makes little difference to me.

187.speaker: The Emperor
187.text: I did what I had to to secure my freedom.

485.speaker: The Emperor
485.text: And in spite of your resistance to completing your evolution - you have proved a good ally.

454.speaker: The Emperor
454.text: And in spite of your resistance to evolution - you have proved a good ally.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: We could not have done it without your help.

681.speaker: The Emperor
681.text: I'm glad you think so. I did my best.

734.speaker: Player
734.text: You didn't give me much choice.

519.speaker: The Emperor
519.text: I am no more responsible for your actions than you are for mine.

562.speaker: Wyll
562.text: No offence meant, of course. I can never forget what you did for us, for the city.

559.speaker: Gale
559.text: Not to cast any slight on you, of course. Your form rather suits you.

672.speaker: Halsin
672.text: Of course, no slight intended towards your form.

125.speaker: Lae'zel
125.text: Only mild offence intended, of course. You did the unthinkable - and I'm grateful for it.

733.speaker: Player
733.text: I saved the world. The sacrifice was worth it.

94.speaker: Lae'zel
94.text: I won't disagree. Chk - did you think I would?

587.speaker: Astarion
587.text: Although - well, better you than me.

679.speaker: Astarion
679.text: I'm glad you see it too. Baldur's Gate will never forget what you did - what we did.

749.speaker: Shadowheart
749.text: Well, I'm certainly glad you feel that way - I doubt I could be so forward-thinking, in your place. Thank you.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: You gave up so much so that others could walk free. I know sacrifice - and I must honour yours.

697.speaker: Gale
697.text: You won't hear a syllable of disagreement from these lips. Thank you.

147.speaker: Halsin
147.text: I believe so. Once the din of battle has faded, we will truly know what has been saved today.

113.speaker: Jaheira
113.text: A simple creed to spout. A harder one to live by.

115.speaker: Minsc
115.text: You wear the flayer's face, and yet your noble soul has not fled before it! I do not know if Boo or I would have your courage.

710.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
710.text: I doubt the world will appreciate your sacrifice. More likely, it will fear and shun you. But you have my thanks, for whatever they are worth.

376.speaker: Lae'zel
376.text: I won't argue. I know - I can barely believe it myself. I will carve your name and deeds in tir'su, forever etched in slate.

311.speaker: Shadowheart
311.text: Everyone owes you, in truth. I'll see that all of Lady Shar's children know of their tentacled champion.

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: Everyone owes you, in truth. And I'll be sure they know of their debt.

405.speaker: Astarion
405.text: Do I? Well I'm sure we can work something out.

769.speaker: Astarion
769.text: For once I will happily admit it - I do. I owe you everything.

488.speaker: Wyll
488.text: No question. The people will sing psalms praising your name - and my voice will be the loudest among them.

650.speaker: Gale
650.text: Have a ponder on what your prize shall be then. I'm still a touch winded from it all...

410.speaker: Halsin
410.text: As does everyone. I have little doubt your efforts will be rewarded in whatever way you see fit.

632.speaker: Jaheira
632.text: Myself and the Coast entire. A debt I'm unlikely to repay in the years left to me, but I suppose I can make the effort.

712.speaker: Minsc
712.text: Minsc and Boo would recommend a statue on the Wide, but it is not always the honour it seems.

294.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
294.text: The whole world owes you, but expect their fear rather than their gratitude. You have my thanks though, for whatever they are worth.

740.speaker: Player
740.text: I did what I had to do.

395.speaker: Lae'zel
395.text: You faced impossible choices. You made the right one. Few would have the nerve.

149.speaker: Shadowheart
149.text: Not just that - you did what no one else was capable of. Thank you.

738.speaker: Astarion
738.text: Indeed you did - I'll make sure the plebs of this city know who they should thank for their continued existence.

363.speaker: Astarion
363.text: Baldur's Gate will never forget it. And neither will I.

527.speaker: Wyll
527.text: You gave up so much so that others could walk free. I know sacrifice - and I must honour yours.

165.speaker: Gale
165.text: Oh, spare me the modesty. They should erect statues to you... though they may frighten children.

72.speaker: Halsin
72.text: So modest of you. Indeed, the mighty oak need not boast of its branches.

577.speaker: Jaheira
577.text: A simple creed to spout. A harder one to live by.

552.speaker: Minsc
552.text: You wear the flayer's face, and yet your noble soul has not fled before it! I do not know if Boo or I would have your courage.

48.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
48.text: And yet it was you who did it. The world will not thank you - it will fear you - but you have my gratitude, for whatever its worth to you.

699.speaker: Player
699.text: It's all right. I like what I've become.

484.speaker: Lae'zel
484.text: You are ghaik. By all accounts, I should hate the very sight of you. But I know the heart that beats within. It belongs to a warrior.

267.speaker: Astarion
267.text: Good! You should always be comfortable in your own skin. Even if that skin is new and... glistening.

673.speaker: Shadowheart
673.text: You do...? Well... all the better then, I suppose.

788.speaker: Wyll
788.text: I must confess, there's a certain dignity to it. The grand champion wearing an unholy skin.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: I like it too. Mucous suits you. And you saved us all.

500.speaker: Halsin
500.text: I'm glad. Being comfortable in one's own skin is key to happiness, I find.

189.speaker: Jaheira
189.text: You 'became' nothing. I suspect you were always the self-sacrificing sort.

133.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
133.text: Strange. But perhaps when I see your enemies cower at your feet, trembling, I will envy you.

259.speaker: Minsc
259.text: As does Minsc. We are both misshapen in our own ways, but Boo loves us still.

649.speaker: Player
649.text: That was very insensitive of you.

188.speaker: Lae'zel
188.text: Have you ever known me to be sensitive?

645.speaker: Shadowheart
645.text: I... I suppose it was. Apologies - I've just been waiting a long time to have the inside of my head to myself.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: Apologies. I just got swept up in - well - surviving.

214.speaker: Wyll
214.text: Was it? A thousand apologies. You are a legend, and no accusation or aspersion can diminish you.

192.speaker: Gale
192.text: Apologies. A slip of the tongue from an overjoyed comrade. Not a drop of malice meant.

283.speaker: Halsin
283.text: My heartfelt apologies. I meant no disrespect to your sacrifice.

390.speaker: Jaheira
390.text: I have never been known for my tact, but honesty is the better virtue by far. So, sincerely - thank you.

32.speaker: Minsc
32.text: You are right. The shame bubbles deep in my gut, as Boo will bear witness to.

384.speaker: Shadowheart
384.text: Not that there's necessarily anything wrong with being a mind flayer, of course...

513.speaker: Astarion
513.text: I would say no offence meant, but... well. Look at you.

741.speaker: Astarion
741.text: Oh, eh - sorry. I didn't mean to... well, you know.

657.speaker: Wyll
657.text: No offence meant, of course. I can never forget your sacrifice for us, for the city.

731.speaker: Gale
731.text: Not to cast any slight on you, of course. Your present form is but a sign of your gallantry.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: Of course, no slight intended towards your new form.

388.speaker: Jaheira
388.text: Ah. Well. Perhaps I speak with too much haste.

349.speaker: Minsc
349.text: Ah, forgive Minsc. It has been said that his mouth sometimes frolicks in fields far ahead of his mind.

617.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
617.text: Although in your case, the transformation may be an improvement.

254.speaker: Orpheus
254.text: You did it. You destroyed the Netherbrain, and ended the Grand Design.

442.speaker: Orpheus
442.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus kneels in gratitude before the player.

365.speaker: Narrator
365.text: *The Netherbrain is destroyed, the Grand Design reduced to dust. And you are forever changed.*

610.speaker: Narrator
610.text: *Your mind flexes, your body ringing with the afterglow of power, daring you to resist, daring you to feel anything but authority.*

727.speaker: Narrator
727.text: *Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have been abandoned by your queen.*

547.speaker: Narrator
547.text: *Your prince has been sacrificed, and you have failed your queen.*

735.speaker: Narrator
735.text: *The engine inside you is silent. You will live, in this strange new form.*

436.speaker: Orpheus
436.text: It's done. The Netherbrain destroyed, the Grand Design ended.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *Almost as an afterthought you notice you lost the powers Mizora gave you. But it doesn't matter anymore. You've never felt so potent.*
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll look himself over, feeling the eldrich energies leaving his body.

466.speaker: The Emperor
466.text: It's done. The brain is defeated. We're - free.
